topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538fc90863687233e3f60000#post_538fc90863687233e3f60000
I'm pretty sure most of those ecologists are not on the teams to bring back extinct species; you have to be extremely qualified to be on those teams working on reintroducing extinct species.  If you spent millions of dollars on bringing back a extinct species only for it to get eaten cause john joe doesn't know how to do his job that's going to get people very angry.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538fc90863687233e3f60000#post_538fc90863687233e3f60000
Many of the people in the de-extinction project are conservationists. They would have thought of this beforehand.

And many species have been re-introduced into habitats which they were once wiped out from. Has that caused any ecological disaster?
topics.author: 50b70eeb7f123b1a02000097

topics.body: So guys I need some advice. There is a cat that lives near my apartment. She's really pregnant and I don't know what to do with her. I've been thinking about adopting one of the kittens when they're born but I can't have a family of felines running around. What is the most humane way to deal with this stuation?
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538fcb7a63687235ab9f0100#post_538fcb7a63687235ab9f0100
Advertise on craigslist that you have free kittens to give to a good home. You can also put posters around your city and tell friends and family to spread the word.
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e

topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538fcb35636872365ddb0100#post_538fcb35636872365ddb0100
Yes, let's cherry-pick the times that scientists screwed up and ignore the fact that they have been successful many more times.
topics.author: 50b70eeb7f123b1a02000097

topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538fcbd763687234bf1a0200#post_538fcbd763687234bf1a0200
That might work. I'm also considering taking the ca to get fixed after she has the kittens.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538fcb66636872348abf0100#post_538fcb66636872348abf0100

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538fcb7a63687235ab9f0100#post_538fcb7a63687235ab9f0100
No kill shelters.  Some will even take pregnant cats.  If not then just feed them until they're old enough and find a family or take them to the shelter.

There is a fee for some no kill shelters though, but a lot of them get adopted cause a lot of people want to buy from a no kill shelter.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
